musicalLanguage.description: Stevie Wonder's iconic funk anthem built on a relentless clavinet riff. This piano arrangement captures the syncopated groove and bluesy minor tonality. The left hand drives a percussive bass pattern while the right hand plays the signature riff with its characteristic chromatic approach tones.
musicalLanguage.structure: Riff-based: 4 bars main riff, 4 bars variation with ascending line
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: The iconic Eb minor clavinet riff — syncopation is everything here.
Bars 5-6: The riff opens up with a climbing figure toward Gb major.
Bar 8: Turnaround back to the top — the funk never stops.
teachingGoals: Syncopated rhythm — playing on the 'and' of beats
Percussive touch on piano to emulate clavinet sound
Coordinating a driving left hand bass with syncopated right hand
styleTips: Play staccato and percussive — think clavinet, not legato piano
Accent the off-beats in the right hand for authentic funk feel
Left hand should be rock-solid and metronomic — it's the drummer
